item.title: LendIt - The world's largest online lending events | LendIt USA 2016
item.description:
LendIt - The world's largest online lending events | LendIt USA 2016

Get more information and join us at the LendIt USA 2016 conference.

item.title: Marketplace Lending Shows Its Strength
item.description:
Marketplace Lending Shows Its Strength

We are very excited about this new asset class. To give you a compelling top-down perspective, my colleagues Bill Ullman , Director, Van Eck Associates Corporation, and Carlos Nogueira , Member of Van Eck's Fixed Income Investment Team have co-authored this special post.

item.title: The fintech bank hoping for a delinquency
item.description:
The fintech bank hoping for a delinquency

In some walks of life, perfect scores are to be admired: exams, computer games and asset management being a few that spring to mind. In others, like election rigging, it simply arouses suspicion. So what should we make of the lending record of Commonbond, a New York-based student loan refinancing company backed by the likes of ex-Citi bankers Vikram Pandit and Hans Morris.

item.title: US banks prepare for assault from online rivals - FT.com
item.description:
US banks prepare for assault from online rivals - FT.com

The big brick-and-mortar banks in the US are bracing themselves for a fresh assault from rapidly growing online lenders, as an imminent interest rate rise from the Federal Reserve intensifies a war for deposits. The big retail banks such as JPMorgan

item.title: Your survival guide for escaping a bear market.
item.description:
Your survival guide for escaping a bear market.

When the going gets tough, the tough get going. Nimble-footed and smart investors should scour the financial landscape for new possibilities -- and also know what to avoid. Below, we explore interesting and often ignored investment alternatives well suited for today's conditions: senior secured loans, peer-to-peer lending and private equity funds.

item.title: Bernie Sanders is Probably Not the Marketplace Lending Candidate of Choice
item.description:
Bernie Sanders is Probably Not the Marketplace Lending Candidate of Choice

Perhaps the fastest way for Americans to become deBanked is to elect Bernie Sanders as President. In a proposal he laid out on Tuesday, Sanders pledged to break up commercial banks, shadow banks and insurance companies that he believes are "Too-Big-to-Fail." While not everyone would be especially sad to see something like that happen, there's [...]

item.title: Lending Club's CEO on Weathering a Rough First Public Year and the San Bernardino Shootings
item.description:
Lending Club's CEO on Weathering a Rough First Public Year and the San Bernardino Shootings

Financial startups may be hotter than ever in Silicon Valley, but public markets investors are decidedly more skeptical. Just ask Renaud Laplanche, founder and CEO of online financial company Lending Club, the leader of this generation of fintech newcomers. In December 2014, Laplanche triumphantly presided over his company's blockbuster IPO, which valued Lending Club at more than $8 billion.

item.title: Lending Club to Announce Q4 Results on February 11th Before Market Open - Crowdfund Insider
item.description:
Lending Club to Announce Q4 Results on February 11th Before Market Open - Crowdfund Insider

Lending Club ( NYSE: LC), the largest marketplace lending platform in the United States, has scheduled its Q4 earnings call for Thursday, February 11th prior to market open. Lending Club will hold a conference call to discuss results with analysts at 8:30 AM ET the same day.
